data.title: A Quick Guide to Time Zones [Archive]
data.meta_description:
Ever get confused about time zones when  
planning a party or meet-up? I know I have. Look no further, you can learn here  
and get your times before posting an event. 
Just copying this over from Wizard101 Central 
  
 
What are Time Zones? 
Across the world, we are all in different times of the day.  
While you might be seeing 4:00 on the clock, In China they will be seeing a  
totally different time! This is why the world is split into different time
data.text:
Elizabeth

Ever get confused about time zones when

planning a party or meet-up? I know I have. Look no further, you can learn here

and get your times before posting an event.

Just copying this over from Wizard101 Central

What are Time Zones?

Across the world, we are all in different times of the day.

While you might be seeing 4:00 on the clock, In China they will be seeing a

totally different time! This is why the world is split into different time

zones.

U.S.A Time Zones http://www.wizard101central.com/forums/picture.php?albumid=14760&pictureid=195139http://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3100&d=1345048377

http://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3099&d=1345048362

http://www.wizard101central.com/forums/picture.php?albumid=14760&pictureid=195467

If you live in America, find your state and

that's your Time zone! For example, if you live in California, you live in the

Pacific time zone. If you live in North Carolina, you live in the Eastern Time

Zone.

So how do they work? Well, each time zone is

exactly one hour behind each other (Hawaii is 2 hours behind Alaskan time), so

if it's 4:00 p.m in the pacific time zone, it's 5 p.m in the mountain time zone,

like this:

1:00 p.m Hawaii Time

3:00 p.m Alaska Time

4:00 p.m Pacific Time

5:00 p.m Mountain Time

6:00 p.m Central Time

7:00 p.m Eastern Time

*note* Arizona does NOT observe daylight's saving time. That means Arizona will not "fall back" or "spring forward" with the rest of America. It will remain on a constant time, so people in Arizona will be following the "Mountain time" until September, then they will be following the "Pacific time".

Canada Time Zoneshttp://www.wizard101central.com/forums/picture.php?albumid=14760&pictureid=195141http://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3104&d=1345048469

http://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3101&d=1345048389

http://www.wizard101central.com/forums/picture.php?albumid=14760&pictureid=195146

If you live in Canada, find the area of the

Province or territory you live in and find which time zone you live in. Each Time zone is exactly one hour behind each

other with a few exceptions:Notice I put mountain time and Saskatchewan

together. This is because they have the same times. If it's 6:00 mountain time,

it's also 6:00 Saskatchewan time. Also, Newfoundland is exactly 1 1/2 hour

behind the other time zones. Confused yet? Let's look at it this way:

If it's 4:00 p.m Pacific time then it is 5 p.m

in Mountain time, like this:

4:00 p.m Pacific time

5:00 p.m Mountain time

5:00 p.m Saskatchewan time

6:00 p.m Central Time

7:00 p.m Eastern Time

8:00 p.m Atlantic Time

9:30 Newfoundland Time

United Kingdom Time Zones http://www.wizard101central.com/forums/picture.php?albumid=14760&pictureid=195147http://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3104&d=1345048469

http://www.wizard101central.com/forums/picture.php?albumid=14760&pictureid=195148

http://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3103&d=1345048434

You British guys may have to help me with this

one if I get it wrong-- According to my research, the whole area of Great

Britain is located in the British Summer Time zone. Are there any other

divisions of time zones there?

*OTHER COUNTRIES INCLUDED IN THE BRITISH SUMMER TIME*

England

Wales

Scotland

Portugal

Northern Ireland

The British Summer Time zone is exactly 5

hours away from Eastern Time zone, so it looks like this all

together:

1:00 p.m Hawaii Time

3:00 p.m Alaska time

4:00 p.m Pacific time

5:00 p.m Mountain time

5:00 p.m Saskatchewan time

6:00 p.m Central Time

7:00 p.m Eastern Time

8:00 p.m Atlantic Time

9:30 Newfoundland Time

12:00 a.m British Summer Time

Australian time Zoneshttp://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3405&d=1345515388

http://pirate101.centralforums.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=3406&d=1345515397

There are 3 time zones in Australia. They are exactly 1 hour apart from each other, so it turns out like this:

1:00 p.m Australian Western Standard Time

2:00 p.m Australian Central Standard Time

3:00 p.m Australian Eastern Standard Time

All together:

Australian Western Standard time is exactly 24 hours from U.S.A Eastern Standard time, so it looks like this:

1:00 p.m Hawaii Time

3:00 p.m Alaska time

4:00 p.m Pacific time

5:00 p.m Mountain time

5:00 p.m Saskatchewan time

6:00 p.m Central Time

7:00 p.m Eastern Time

8:00 p.m Atlantic Time

9:30 Newfoundland Time

12:00 a.m British Summer Time

7:00 a.m Western Australian Time

8:00 a.m Central Australian Time

9:00 a.m Eastern Australian Time

*Information About Daylight Savings Time*

Daylight savings time is observed March 11 at 2:00 am moving the hour forward 1 hour (Spring Forward)

November 4 begins the Savings time moving the clock back 1 hour (Fall Back)

*NOTE* Hawaii and Arizona DO NOT observe Daylight Savings time. Your clocks will remain the same

*NOTE* ONLY Southeastern Australia (EAS) observes Daylight Savings time. All other areas formerly observed it but no longer do.

Hope this guide helped you guys out a little bit!

Feel free to correct any mistakes I make
